p: Additionally, the interleukin-6 human monoclonal antibody tocilizumab is being studied in a clinical trial for COVID-19 treatment (Chugai Pharmaceutical, Zhejiang Hisun Pharmaceutical, Jiangsu Qyun Bio-Pharmaceutical, Jiangsu, China). This novel use of a monoclonal antibody as an antiviral agent is suggested to work through its immunosuppression of acute-phase reactants, which is associated with inflammation and leukocyte recruitment and could potentially reduce respiratory distress. Another promising and emerging area of investigation is the use of convalescent plasma in patients with severe COVID-19 presentations. Early results suggest that this therapy may clear viremia by way of neutralizing antibodies from recovered donors ( Duan et al., 2020).
